channel.title: SQL help
channel.description:
My server is SQL but will only
Connect to the SQL when ip set to localhost or 127.0.0.1
if i set it to my ip itzkyle.no-ip.*** and set username and password correctly it wont work and suggestions?

item.title: SQL help
item.dc:creator: @itzkyle Lusfr
item.description:
@itzkyle wrote:

[quote=“Envion, post:4, topic:153979”][quote author=itzkyle link=topic=210383.msg1842659#msg1842659 date=1193291694]
I know that thats what i did i used the other machines ip and it still wouldn’t connect and not everyone is smart i’m new to SQl gawd.
[/quote]

Is that machine behind a router?
If so, are you networked to it?
If not, are you using an IP that would connect directly to it? ----.no-ip.wtvr won’t do a hell of a lot of good if it redirects to the machine you’re using at the moment.[/quote]

no router
not networked to it
no firewall active at the moment
using real ip not no-ip

Read full topic

item.title: SQL help
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

itzkyle:

I know that thats what i did i used the other machines ip and it still wouldn’t connect and not everyone is smart i’m new to SQl gawd.

Is that machine behind a router?
If so, are you networked to it?
If not, are you using an IP that would connect directly to it? ----.no-ip.wtvr won’t do a hell of a lot of good if it redirects to the machine you’re using at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: SQL help
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

…when you set the MySQL host, it will typically be localhost. If you’re hosting it on a different machine, it would be that machine’s IP. It does not need to be your server IP.

My god.

Read full topic
